title: 1.疯狂年代
paragraphs: “红色联合”对“四·二八兵团”总部大楼的攻击已持续了两天，他们的旗帜在大楼周围躁动地飘扬着，仿佛渴望干柴的火种。“红色联合”的指挥官心急如焚，他并不惧怕大楼的守卫者，那二百多名“四·二八”战士，与诞生于l966年初、经历过大检阅和大串联的“红色联合”相比要稚嫩许多。他怕的是大楼中那十几个大铁炉子，里面塞满了烈性炸药，用电雷管串联起来，他看不到它们，但能感觉到它们磁石般的存在，开关一合，玉石俱焚，而“四·二八”的那些小红卫兵们是有这个精神力量的。比起已经在风雨中成熟了许多的第一代红卫兵，新生的造反派们像火炭上的狼群，除了疯狂还是疯狂。

大楼顶上出现了一个娇小的身影，那个美丽的女孩子挥动着一面“四·二八”的大旗，她的出现立刻招来了一阵杂乱的枪声，射击的武器五花八门，有陈旧的美式卡宾枪、捷克式机枪和三八大盖，也有崭新的制式步枪和冲锋枪——后者是在“八月社论”发表之后从军队中偷抢来的（注：1967年8月《红旗》杂志发表“揪军内一小撮”的社论，使冲击军区、抢夺军队枪支弹药的事件愈演愈烈，全国范围的武斗也进入高·潮。）——连同那些梭标和大刀等冷兵器，构成了一部浓缩的近现代史……“四·二八”的人在前面多次玩过这个游戏，在楼顶上站出来的人，除了挥舞旗帜外，有时还用喇叭筒喊口号或向下撒传单，每次他们都能在弹雨中全身而退，为自己挣到了崇高的荣誉。这次出来的女孩儿显然也相信自己还有那样的幸运她挥舞着战旗，挥动着自己燃烧的青春，敌人将在这火焰中化为灰烬，理想世界明天就会在她那沸腾的热血中诞生……她陶醉在这鲜红灿烂的梦幻中，直到被一颗步枪子弹洞穿了胸膛，十五岁少女的胸膛是那么柔嫩，那颗子弹穿过后基本上没有减速，在她身后的空中发出一声啾鸣。年轻的红卫兵同她的旗帜一起从楼顶落下，她那轻盈的身体落得甚至比旗帜还慢，仿佛小鸟眷恋着天空。

“红色联合”的战士们欢呼起来，几个人冲到楼下，掀开四．二八的旗帜，抬起下面纤小的遗体，作为一个战利品炫耀地举了一段，然后将她高高地扔向大院的铁门，铁门上带尖的金属栅条大部分在武斗初期就被抽走当梭标了，剩下的两条正好挂住了她，那一瞬间，生命似乎又回到了那个柔软的躯体。红色联合的红卫兵们退后一段距离，将那个挂在高处的躯体当靶子练习射击，密集的子弹对她来说已柔和如雨，不再带来任何感觉，她那春藤般的手臂不时轻挥一下，仿佛拂去落在身上的雨滴，直到那颗年轻的头颅被打掉了一半，仅剩的一只美丽的眼睛仍然凝视着一九六七年的蓝天，目光中没有痛苦，只有凝固的激情和渴望。
其实，比起另外一些人来，她还是幸运的，至少是在为理想献身的壮丽激情中死去。
这样的热点遍布整座城市，像无数并行运算的CPU，将“文革大革命”联为一个整体。疯狂如同无形的洪水，将城市淹没其中并渗透到每一个细微的角落和缝隙。

在城市边缘的那所著名大学的操场上，一场几千人参加的批斗会已经进行了近两个小时。在这个派别林立的年代，任何一处都有错综复杂的对立派别在格斗。在校园中，红卫兵、文革工作组、工宣队和军宣队，相互之间都在爆发尖锐的冲突，而每种派别的内部又时时分化出新的对立派系，捍卫着各自不同的背景和纲领，爆发更为残酷的较量。但这次被批斗的反动学术权威，却是任何一方均无异议的斗争目标，他们也只能同时承受来自各方的残酷打击。
与其他的牛鬼蛇神相比，反动学术权威有他们的特点：当打击最初到来时，他们的表现往往是高傲而顽固的，这也是他们伤亡率最高的阶段；在首都，四十天的时间里就有一千七百多名批斗对象被活活打死，更多的人选择了更快捷的路径来逃避疯狂，老舍、吴晗、葛伯赞、傅雷、赵九章、以群、闻捷、海默等，都自己结束了他们那曾经让人肃然起敬的生命。

从这一阶段幸存下来的人，在持续的残酷打击下渐渐麻木，这是一种自我保护的精神外壳，使他们避免最后的崩溃。他们在批斗会上常常进入半睡眠状态，只有一声恫吓才能使其惊醒过来，机械地重复那已说过无数遍的认罪词；然后，他们中的一部分人便进入了第三阶段，旷日持久的批判将鲜明的政治图像如水银般注入了他们的意识，将他们那由知识和理性构筑的思想大厦彻底摧毁，他们真的相信自己有罪，真的看到了自己对伟大事业构成的损害，并为此痛哭流涕，他们的忏悔往往比那此非知识分子的牛鬼蛇神要深刻得多，也真诚得多；而对于红卫兵来说，进入后两个阶段的批判对象是最乏味的，只有处于第一阶段的牛鬼蛇神才能对他们那早已过度兴奋的神经产生有效的刺激，如同斗牛士手上的红布，但这样的对象越来越少了，在这所大学中可能只剩下一个，他由于自己的珍稀而被留到批判大会最后出场。

叶哲泰从文革开始一直活到了现在，并且一直处于第一阶段，他不认罪，不自杀，也不麻木。当这位物理学教授走上批判台时，他那神情分明在说：让我背负的十字架更沉重一些吧！红卫兵们让他负担的东西确实很重，但不是十字架。别的批判对象戴的高帽子都是用竹条扎的框架，而他戴的这顶却是用一指粗的钢筋焊成的，还有他挂在胸前的那块牌子，也不是别人挂的木板，而是从实验室的一个烤箱上拆下的铁门，上面用黑色醒目地写着他的名字，并沿对角线画上了一个红色的大叉。

押送叶哲泰上台的红卫兵比别的批判对象多了一倍，有六人，两男四女。两个男青年步伐稳健有力，一副成熟的青年布尔什维克形象，他们都是物理系理论物理专业大四年级的，叶哲泰曾是他们的老师；那四名女孩子要年轻得多，都是大学附中的初二学生，这些穿着军装扎着武装带的小战士挟带着逼人的青春活力，像四团绿色的火焰包围着叶哲泰。叶哲泰的出现使下面的人群兴奋起来，刚才已有些乏力的口号声又像新一轮海潮般重新高昂起来，淹没了一切。
耐心地等口号声平息下去后，台上两名男红卫兵中的一人转向批判对象：“叶哲泰，你精通各种力学，应该看到自己正在抗拒的这股伟大的合力是多么强大，顽固下去是死路一条！今天继续上次大会的议程，废话就不多说了。老实回答下面的问题：在六二至六五届的基础课中，你是不是擅自加入了大量的相对论内容？！”
“相对论已经成为物理学的古典理论，基础课怎么能不涉及它呢？”叶哲泰回答说。
“你胡说！”旁边的一名女红卫兵厉声说，“爱因斯坦是反动的学术权威，他有奶便是娘，跑去为美帝国主义造原子弹！要建立起革命的科学，就要打倒以相对论为代表的资产阶级理论黑旗！”
叶哲泰沉默着，他在忍受着头上铁高帽和胸前铁板带来的痛苦，不值得回应的问题就沉默了。在他身后，他的学生也微微皱了一下眉头。说话的女孩儿是这四个中学红卫兵中天资最聪颖的一个，并且显然有备而来，刚才上台前还看到她在背批判稿，但要对付叶哲泰，仅凭她那几句口号是不行的。他们决定亮出今天为老师准备的新武器，其中的一人对台下挥了一下手。
叶哲泰的妻子，同系的物理学教授绍琳从台下的前排站起来，走上台。她身穿一件很不合体的草绿色衣服，显然想与红卫兵的色彩拉近距离，但熟悉绍琳的人联想到以前常穿精致旗袍讲课的她，总觉得别扭。

“叶哲泰！”绍琳指着丈夫喝道，她显然不习惯于这种场合，尽量拔高自己的声音，却连其中的颤抖也放大了，“你没有想到我会站出来揭发你，批判你吧！？是的，我以前受你欺骗，你用自己那反动的世界观和科学观蒙蔽了我！现在我醒悟了，在革命小将的帮助下，我要站到革命的一边，人民的一边！”她转向台下，/”同志们、革命小将们、革命的教职员工们，我们应该认清爱因斯坦相对论的反动本质，这种本质，广义相对论体现得最清楚；它提出的静态宇宙模型，否定了物质的运动本性，是反辩证法的！它认为宇宙有限，更是彻头彻尾的反动唯心主义……”
听着妻子滔滔不绝的演讲，叶哲泰苦笑了一下。琳，我蒙蔽了你？其实你在我心中倒一直是个谜。一次，我对你父亲称赞你那过人的天资——他很幸运，去得早，躲过了这场灾难——老人家摇摇头，说我女儿不可能在学术上有什么建树；接着，他说出了对我后半生很重要的一句话：琳琳太聪明了，可是搞基础理论，不笨不行啊。

以后的许多年里，我不断悟出这话的深意。琳，你真的太聪明了，早在几年前，你就嗅出了知识界的政治风向，做出了一些超前的举动，比如你在教学中，把大部分物理定律和参数都改了名字，欧姆定律改叫电阻定律，麦克斯韦方程改名成电磁方程，普朗克常数叫成了量子常数……你对学生们解释说：所有的科学成果都是广大劳动人民智慧的结晶，那些资产阶级学术权威不过是窃取了这些智慧。但即使这样，你仍然没有被“革命主流”所接纳，看看现在的你，衣袖上没有“革命教职员工”都戴着的红袖章；你两手空空地上来，连一本语录都没资格拿……谁让你出生在旧中国那样一个显赫的家庭，你父母又都是那么著名的学者。
说起爱因斯坦，你比我有更多的东西需要交待。1922年冬天，爱因斯坦到上海访问，你父亲因德语很好被安排为接待陪同者之一。你多次告诉我，父亲是在爱因斯坦的亲自教诲下走上物理学之路的，而你选择物理专业又是受了父亲的影响，所以爱翁也可以看作你的间接导师，你为此感到无比的自豪和幸福。

后来我知道，父亲对你讲了善意的谎言，他与爱因斯坦只有过一次短得不能再短的交流。那是l922年11月l3日上午，他陪爱因斯坦到南京路散步，同行的好像还有上海大学校长于右任、《大公报》经理曹谷冰等人，经过一个路基维修点，爱因斯坦在一名砸石子的小工身旁停下，默默看着这个在寒风中衣衫破烂、手脸污黑的男孩子，问你父亲：他一天挣多少钱？问过小工后，你父亲回答：五分。这就是他与改变世界的科学大师唯一的一次交流，没有物理学，没有相对论，只有冰冷的现实。据你父亲说，爱因斯坦听到他的回答后又默默地站在那里好一会儿，看着小工麻木的劳作，手里的烟斗都灭了也没有吸一口。你父亲在回忆这件事后，对我发出这样的感叹：在中国，任何超脱飞扬的思想都会砰然坠地的，现实的引力太沉重了。
“低下头！”一名男红卫兵大声命令。这也许是自己的学生对老师一丝残存的同情，被批斗者都要低头，但叶哲泰要这样，那顶沉重的铁高帽就会掉下去，以后只要他一直低着头，就没有理由再给他戴上。但叶哲泰仍昂着头，用瘦弱的脖颈支撑着那束沉重的钢铁。
“低头！你个反动顽固分子！！”旁边一名女红卫兵解下腰间的皮带朝叶哲泰挥去，黄铜带扣正打在他脑门上，在那里精确地留下了带扣的形状，但很快又被淤血模糊成黑紫的一团。他摇晃了一下，又站稳了。
一名男红卫兵质问叶哲泰：“在量子力学的教学中，你也散布过大量的反动言论！”说完对绍琳点点头，示意她继续。
绍琳迫不及待地要继续下去了，她必须不停顿地说下去，以维持自己那摇摇欲坠的精神免于彻底垮掉。“叶哲泰，这一点你是无法抵赖的！你多次向学生散布反动的哥本哈根解释！”
“这毕竟是目前公认的最符合实验结果的解释。”叶哲泰说，在受到如此重击后，他的口气还如此从容，这让绍琳很吃惊，也很恐惧。
“这个解释认为，是外部的观察导致了量子波函数的坍缩，这是反动唯心论的另一种表现形式，而且是一种最猖狂的表现！”
“是哲学指引实验还是实验指引哲学？”叶哲泰问道，他这突然的反击令批判者们一时不知所措。
“当然是正确的马克思主义哲学指引科学实验！”一名男红卫兵说。
“这等于说正确的哲学是从天上掉下来的，这反对实践出真知，恰恰是违背马克思主义对自然界的认知原则的。”
绍琳和两名大学红卫兵无言以对，与中学和社会上的红卫兵不同，他们不可能一点儿道理也不讲。但来自附中的四位小将自有她们“无坚不摧”的革命方式，刚才动手的那个女孩儿又狠抽了叶哲泰一皮带，另外三个女孩子也都分别抡起皮带抽了一下，当同伴革命时，她们必须表现得更革命，至少要同样革命。两名男红卫兵没有过问，他们要是现在管这事，也有不革命的嫌疑。
“你还在教学中散布宇宙大爆炸理论，这是所有科学理论中最反动的一个！”一名男红卫兵试图转移话题。
“也许以后这个理论会被推翻，但本世纪的两大宇宙学发现：哈勃红移和3K宇宙背景辐射，使大爆炸学说成为目前为止最可信的宇宙起源理论。”
“胡说！”绍琳大叫起来，又接着滔滔不绝地讲起了宇宙大爆炸，自然不忘深刻地剖析其反动本质。但这理论的超级新奇吸引了四个小女孩儿中最聪明的那一个，她不由自主地问道：“连时间都是从那个奇点开始的！？那奇点以前有什么？”
“什么都没有。”叶哲泰说，像回答任何一个小女孩儿的问题那样，他转头慈祥地看着她，铁高帽和已受的重伤，使他这动作很艰难。
“什么……都没有？！反动！反动透顶！！”那女孩儿惊恐万状地大叫起来，她不知所措地转向绍琳寻求帮助，立刻得到了。
“这给上帝的存在留下了位置。”绍琳对女孩儿点点头提示说。
小红卫兵那茫然的思路立刻找到了立脚点，她举起紧握皮带的手指着叶哲泰，“你，是想说有上帝？！”
“我不知道。”
“你说什么！”
“我是说不知道，如果上帝是指宇宙之外的超意识的话，我不知道它是不是存在；正反两方面，科学都没给出确实的证据。”其实，在这噩梦般的时刻，叶哲泰已倾向于相信它不存在了。
这句大逆不道的话在整个会场引起了骚动，在台上一名红卫兵的带领下，又爆发了一波波的口号声。
“打倒反动学术权威叶哲泰！！”
“打倒一切反动学术权威！！”
“打倒一切反动学说！！”
“上帝是不存在的，一切宗教，都是统治阶级编造出来的麻痹人民的精神工具！”口号平息后，那个小女孩儿大声说。鬼吹灯小说
“这种看法是片面的。”叶哲泰平静地说。

恼羞成怒的小红卫兵立刻做出了判断，对于眼前这个危险的敌人，一切语言都无意义了。她抡起皮带冲上去，她的三个小同志立刻跟上，叶哲泰的个子很高，这四个十四岁的女孩儿只能朝上抡皮带才能打到他那不肯低下的头，在开始的几下打击后，他头上能起一定保护作用的铁高帽被打掉了，接下来带铜扣的宽皮带如雨点般打在他的头上和身上——他终于倒下了，这鼓舞了小红卫兵们，她们更加投入地继续着这“崇高”的战斗，她们在为信念而战，为理想而战，她们为历史给予自己的光辉使命所陶醉，为自己的英勇而自豪……
“最高指示：要文斗不要武斗！”叶哲泰的两名学生终于下定了决心，喊出了这句话，两人同时冲过去，拉开了已处于半疯狂状态的四个小女孩儿。
但已经晚了，物理学家静静地躺在地上，半睁的双眼看着从他的头颅上流出的血迹，疯狂的会场瞬间陷入了一片死寂，那条血迹是唯一在动的东西，它像一条红蛇缓慢地蜿蜒爬行着，到达台沿后一滴滴地滴在下面一个空箱子上，发出有节奏的/”哒哒/”声，像渐行渐远的脚步。
一阵怪笑声打破了寂静，这声音是精神已彻底崩溃的绍琳发出的，听起来十分恐怖。人们开始离去，最后发展成一场大溃逃，每个人想都尽快逃离这个地方。会场很快空了下来，只剩下一个姑娘站在台下。
她是叶哲泰的女儿叶文洁。

当那四个女孩儿施暴夺去父亲生命时，她曾想冲上台去，但身边的两名老校工死死抓住她，并在耳边低声告诉她别连自己的命也不要了，当时会场已经处于彻底的癫狂，她的出现只会引出更多的暴徒。她曾声嘶力竭地哭叫，但声音淹没在会场上疯狂的口号和助威声中，当一切寂静下来时，她自己也发不出任何声音了，只是凝视台上父亲已没有生命的躯体，那没有哭出和喊出的东西在她的血液中弥漫、溶解，将伴她一生。人群散去后，她站在那里，身体和四肢仍保持着老校工抓着她时的姿态，一动不动，像石化了一般。过了好久，她才将悬空的手臂放下来，缓缓起身走上台，坐在父亲的遗体边，握起他的一只已凉下来的手，两眼失神地看着远方。当遗体要被抬走时，叶文洁从衣袋中拿出一样东西放到父亲的那只手中，那是父亲的烟斗。
文洁默默地离开了已经空无一人一片狼藉的操场，走上回家的路。当她走到教工宿舍楼下时，听到了从二楼自家窗口传出的一阵阵痴笑声，这声音是那个她曾叫做妈妈的女人发出的。文洁默默地转身走去，任双脚将她带向别处。

她最后发现自己来到了阮雯的家门前，在大学四年中，阮老师一直是她的班主任，也是她最亲密的朋友。在叶文洁读天体物理专业研究生的两年里，再到后来停课闹革命至今，阮老师一直是她除父亲外最亲近的人。阮雯曾留学剑桥，她的家曾对叶文洁充满了吸引力，那里有许多从欧洲带回来的精致的书籍、油画和唱片，一架钢琴；还有一排放在精致小木架上的欧式烟斗，父亲那只就是她送的，这些烟斗有地中海石楠根的，有土耳其海泡石的，每一个都仿佛浸透了曾将它们拿在手中和含在嘴里深思的那个男人的智慧，但阮雯从未提起过他。这个雅致温暖的小世界成为文洁逃避尘世风暴的港湾。但那是阮雯的家被抄之前的事，她在运动中受到的冲击和文洁父亲一样重，在批斗会上，红卫兵把高跟鞋挂到她脖子上，用口红在她的脸上划出许多道子，以展示她那腐朽的资产阶级生活方式。

叶文洁推开阮雯的家门，发现抄家后混乱的房间变得整洁了，那几幅被撕的油画又贴糊好挂在墙上，歪倒的钢琴也端正地立在原位，虽然已被砸坏不能弹了，但还是擦得很干净，残存的几本精装书籍也被整齐地放回书架上……阮雯端坐在写字台前的那把转椅上，安详地闭着双眼。叶文洁站在她身边，摸摸她的额头、脸和手，都是冰凉的，其实文洁在进门后就注意到了写字台上倒放着的那个已空的安眠药瓶。她默默地站了一会儿，转身走去，悲伤已感觉不到了，她现在就像一台盖革计数仪，当置身于超量的辐射中时，反而不再有任何反应，没有声响，读数为零。但当她就要出门时，还是回过头来最后看了阮雯一眼，她发现阮老师很好地上了妆，她抹了口红，也穿上了高跟鞋。

translated_paragraphs: China, 1967.

"The Red Combine" has been attacking the headquarters building of the "Fourth February Column" for two days, and their flags are fluttering wildly around the building, as if they yearn to be the spark that ignites the dry wood. The commander of the Red Combine is in a hurry, he is not afraid of the guards of the building, those 200 "Fourth February" soldiers who were born in early 1966, went through grand inspection and grand chain of events, and compared to the "Red Combine" that was born in the early 1960s and experienced grand inspection and grand chain of events, they are much younger. He is afraid of the dozen large blast furnaces inside the building, which are filled with high explosives, connected by electric detonators, he cannot see them, but he can feel their magnetic existence, as soon as the switch is turned on, everything will be in flames, and the "Fourth February" little Red Guards have this kind of spiritual power. Compared with the first generation Red Guards who have matured in the wind and rain, the newborn counter-revolutionaries are like a pack of wolves on the hot charcoal, crazy and crazy.

A tiny figure appeared on the rooftop of the building, a beautiful girl waving a large flag with "April 28" written on it. Her appearance immediately attracted a burst of gunfire, with a variety of weapons being used, including old American M1 carbines, Czech Zastava machine guns, and old Type 38 rifles, as well as new military rifles and submachine guns - the latter having been stolen from the army after the "August editorial" was published (Note: The "August editorial" was published in August 1967 in the红旗 magazine, which further fueled the incidents of冲击 military areas and stealing military weapons and ammunition across the country, and the nationwide struggle also reached its climax. ) - along with spears and large knives, which formed a condensed modern history... The people who played this game several times before April 28th stood out on the rooftop, in addition to waving flags, they sometimes used loudspeakers to shout slogans or throw leaflets down. Each time they were able to retreat safely and earn themselves noble honors. This time, the girl who came out seemed to believe that she still had such luck. She waved the flag, waved her burning youth, and the enemies would be turned to ashes in the flames, and a new ideal world would be born in her boiling热血 tomorrow... She was lost in this bright red dream until a bullet from a rifle pierced her chest. The chest of a 15-year-old girl was so soft, and the bullet基本上 did not slow down after passing through it. It emitted a chirping sound in the air behind her. The young Red Guards, together with her flag, fell from the rooftop, her lightweight body fell even slower than the flag, as if a bird was reluctant to leave the sky.

The Red Guards cheered as a few rushed downstairs, raised the 4.28 flag, lifted the tiny body, and held it aloft as a trophy, then threw it high into the iron gate of the big yard. Most of the pointed metal bars on the gate had been removed during the initial stage of the fighting to use as spears, leaving only two that just hung there. In that instant, life seemed to return to the soft body. The Red Guards stepped back a few paces and used the suspended body as a target for shooting practice. The dense bullets were now soft as rain to her, and no longer brought any sensation. Her藤蔓般的手臂 occasionally moved lightly, as if brushing away raindrops that fell on her. Until the young head was struck in half, leaving only one beautiful eye that still gazed up at the blue sky of 1967. There was no pain in the eyes, only a frozen passion and desire.
In fact, compared to some other people, she was still lucky. At least she died in the grand passion of dedicating herself to her ideals.
Such hotspots are scattered throughout the city, like countless parallel processors, linking "Cultural Revolution Great Revolution" into a whole.疯狂如同无形的洪水，将城市淹没其中并渗透到每一个细微的角落和缝隙.

At the操场 of a famous university located on the outskirts of the city, a denunciation meeting with thousands of attendees has been going on for nearly two hours. In this era of factionalism, there are complex factions fighting everywhere. On campus, Red Guards, Cultural Revolution work groups, worker propagandists, and military propagandists are engaged in sharp conflicts with each other, and each faction is constantly splitting into new factions to defend their respective backgrounds and slogans, leading to more brutal confrontations. But this time, the counter-revolutionary academic authority to be denounced is a target of consensus for all sides, and they can only bear残酷 attacks from all sides at the same time.

Compared with other demons and spirits, the characteristics of counter-revolutionary academic authorities are as follows: when the initial attack comes, their performance is often arrogant and stubborn, which is also the stage with the highest death rate for them; in the capital, more than a thousand and seven hundred people were beaten to death alive within forty days, and more people chose a faster path to escape madness. Lu Xun, Wu Han, Ge Baozhan, Fu Lei, Zhao Juzhang, Yishu, Wei Jie, and Hai默 all ended their once-respected lives on their own.

The people who survive this stage become numb under the continuous cruel blows, which is a spiritual shell for self-protection, keeping them from collapsing at last. They often enter a semi-sleep state during the denunciation meetings, only being awakened by a loud warning and repeating the same confessions they have said countless times. Then, some of them enter the third stage, where the prolonged criticism injects a vivid political image like mercury into their consciousness, destroying the intellectual and rational edifice they have built with knowledge and reason. They really believe they are guilty, really see the harm they have caused to the great cause, and cry buckets over it. Their confessions are often much deeper and more sincere than those of the non-intellectual beasts and spirits. For Red Guards, the subjects of the second and third stages of criticism are the most boring. Only those in the first stage can stimulate their already overly excited nerves, just like the red cloth in the hand of the bullfighters. But such objects are becoming increasingly rare. Perhaps only one such person remains in this university, who is valued for his rarity and is kept until the last appearance at the denunciation meeting.
Sure, I can do that. Please provide the Chinese text you would like me to translate.

Yecho Taizhi has been alive since the Cultural Revolution and has always been in the first stage. He does not confess, commit suicide, or become numb. When this physics professor stepped onto the criticism stage, his expression was clear: "Let me bear the heavier cross!" The Red Guards really put a lot of burden on him, but it was not a cross. The hats worn by other criticism targets were made of bamboo strips, but his was made of a one-inch steel bar, and the plaque he hung around his neck was not a wooden board that others hung, but a metal door from a laboratory oven, with his name written in bold black letters and a large red cross drawn diagonally across it.

Red Guards who escorted Ye Zetai onto the stage were twice as many as other critics, with six people, two men and four women. The two young men walked steadily and powerfully, with a mature image of young Communist Party members. They were all fourth-year students in the Department of Theoretical Physics, and Ye Zetai had been their teacher. The four girls were much younger, all middle school students from a university attached school. These young soldiers dressed in military uniforms and wearing arm bands exuded a fierce青春活力, like four green flames surrounding Ye Zetai. Ye Zetai's appearance excited the people below, and the slogans that had begun to flag a little earlier rose again like a new tide, drowning everything.

Wait patiently for the slogan to die down, and one of the two male Red Guards on stage turns to the target for criticism: "Ye Zetai, you are proficient in various mechanics, and you should see how powerful and stubborn this great unified force is that you are resisting. It's a dead end to persist! Today we continue the agenda of the last grand meeting. There's no need to say much nonsense. Please answer the following question honestly: In the basic courses of the sixth and sixth grades, did you add a large amount of Einstein's theory of relativity on your own?"
"相对论 has become a classical theory in physics. How can a basic course not involve it?" Ye Zetai replied.

"You're talking nonsense!" a female Red Guard said loudly beside her, "Einstein is an anti-revolutionary academic authority with no principles. He will sell out to anyone who gives him milk. He went to make nuclear bombs for the American imperialists! To establish a revolutionary science, we must raise the black flag of the capitalist theoretical representatives, such as相对论!"

Yeh Ze-tai remained silent, enduring the pain caused by the iron hat on his head and the iron plate on his chest. He remained silent for those questions that were not worth answering. Behind him, his students also slightly furrowed their brows. The girl who spoke was the most intelligent among the four middle school Red Guards and clearly came prepared. She had been seen reciting the criticism speech before going up to the stage, but dealing with Ye Ze-tai was not enough with just her slogans. They decided to show their new weapon prepared for the teacher today. One of them waved their hand towards the audience.

Mrs. Ye Zetai, a professor of physics in the same department as him, stood up from the front row of the audience and walked onto the stage. She was wearing a very ill-fitting green dress, obviously trying to get closer to the color of the Red Guards, but those who were familiar with her thought of her previous elegant旗袍 lectures and felt awkward.

"Yecho Taite!" Mrs.绍琳 pointed at her husband and shouted, she was obviously not used to such an occasion and tried to raise her voice as high as possible, but even the颤抖 in it was magnified, "Did you not think I would stand up and expose you, criticize you? Yes, I was deceived by you before, you used your reactionary world view and scientific view to blind me! Now I have awakened, with the help of the young revolutionaries, I will stand on the side of the revolution, the people's side!" She turned to the audience below, "Comrades, young revolutionaries, revolutionary teachers and employees, we should recognize the reactionary nature of Einstein's theory of relativity. This nature is most clearly reflected in the general theory of relativity. Its static model of the universe denies the nature of motion of matter, it is counter-dialectical! It believes that the universe is limited, and it is an absolutely reactionary idealism... "

Hearing his wife's endless speech, Ye Zetai smiled wryly. Lin, have I deceived you? Actually, you've always been a mystery to me in my heart. Once, I praised your outstanding talent to your father - he was lucky to go early and avoid this disaster - the old man shook his head and said that my daughter couldn't make any contributions in academic research; then he said a sentence that was very important to my later life: Linlin is too smart, but to do basic research, you can't be stupid.

For many years to come, I kept discovering the profound meaning of these words. Lin, you are really too smart. Several years ago, you already sensed the political winds in the academic world and took some forward-looking actions, such as changing the names of most of the physical laws and parameters in your teaching, renaming Ohm's Law as the Law of Resistances, renaming Maxwell's Equations as the Electromagnetic Equations, renaming Planck's Constant as the Quantum Constant... You explained to your students that all scientific achievements are the crystallization of the wisdom of the vast working people, and those academic authorities of the bourgeoisie are nothing more than thieves of this wisdom. But even so, you were not accepted by the "mainstream of the revolution," look at you now, there is no "Red Armband" on your sleeves; you came empty-handed, not even entitled to a copy of the Little Red Book... Who made you born in a prominent family in old China, and your parents were both famous scholars.

When it comes to Einstein, you have more to tell me. In the winter of 1922, Einstein visited Shanghai, and your father, who was good at German, was arranged to be one of the receptionists accompanying him. You told me many times that your father had walked on the path of physics under Einstein's personal instruction, and you chose to major in physics under the influence of your father, so Einstein could also be regarded as your indirect mentor, which made you feel extremely proud and happy.

Later on, I learned that my father had told you a善意谎言. He had only had a brief conversation with Einstein, which was so brief that it could not have been any shorter. It was on November 13, 1922, in the morning. He accompanied Einstein to walk along Nanjing Road, and there seemed to be Shanghai University President Yu Youren, Manager曹谷冰 of the Dagong Bao, and others. After passing by a construction site for roadbed repair, Einstein stopped by the side of a boy who was throwing stones. Yan Wenjie pushed open the door to Ruan Lan's home and found that the messy room that had been ransacked was tidy again. The few paintings that had been torn apart were pasted back up on the walls, the upright piano that had been knocked over was placed back in its original position, although it was damaged and could no longer be played, it was still clean, and the few remaining hardcover books were neatly arranged on the bookshelf...Ruan Lan sat in the swivel chair in front of the writing desk, calmly closing her eyes. Ye Wenjie stood by her side, touched her forehead, face, and hands, which were all cold. In fact, Wenjie had noticed the empty sleeping pill bottle that was turned over on the writing desk as soon as she entered the room. She stood there in silence for a while, turned around and walked away. Sadness had disappeared, and she now felt like a Geiger counter. When exposed to excessive radiation, it no longer reacts, there is no sound, and the reading is zero. But just as she was about to leave, she turned back and looked at Ruan Lan one last time. She found that Ruan Teacher had put on makeup, she applied lipstick, and she was wearing high heels.
en_translation_baichuan2_7b: China, 1967.

在文革期间，红卫兵是新左派的一个组织，他们的目标是推翻旧的统治阶层和反对所谓的“资产阶级反动权威”。他们进行了大规模的抄家和暴力行为，导致了数千人死亡。第一代红卫兵是指那些最早参与红卫兵运动的人，而新一代的红卫兵则是指在红卫兵运动之后加入的人。

造反派是一个更广泛的概念，指的是在文革期间支持各种政治派别和组织的人群。他们的目标和策略各不相同，有些是激进的革命者，有些则是试图维护现有秩序的人。他们在文革期间起到了重要的作用，但也有很多暴力和混乱事件是他们参与的。
这是一个充满激情和狂热的年代，但也是一个充满暴力和悲剧的年代。年轻的红卫兵为了追求理想世界，不惜付出生命的代价，但她们的理想最终却成为了一场悲剧。在这个时代，人们的信仰和价值观发生了巨大的变化，导致了无数的家庭破碎和人性的扭曲。然而，历史总是要前进的，那些悲剧和悲剧中的英雄们，最终也将被时间所遗忘。
这段文字描绘了一个极端暴力和残忍的场景，展示了红卫兵对被批判者的残酷迫害。这种描述可能会引起阅读者的不适，建议谨慎对待。
In fact, compared to some others, she is still lucky, at least dying in the magnificent passion for her ideals.

Such hot spots cover the entire city like countless parallel computing CPUs, linking the "Great Proletarian Cultural Revolution" as a whole. Crazy as an invisible flood, it submerges the city and penetrates into every nook and cranny.
这种极端的政治斗争和暴力手段，不仅导致了大量的无辜者受到伤害，也破坏了社会正常秩序和人民的生活。然而，这种政治斗争并没有持续太久，随着文化大革命的结束，各种政治势力开始重新洗牌，人民也开始重新思考和发展国家和社会。

然而，随着时间的推移，这些知识分子开始意识到，他们无法抵抗这种疯狂的暴力。他们开始寻求与其他知识分子合作，试图找到一种方法来改变这种残酷的局面。在这个过程中，他们逐渐认识到，他们需要与更多的人合作，以便更好地表达他们的观点和诉求。因此，他们开始与其他受到迫害的知识分子建立联系，共同寻求解决方案。

在这个过程中，这些知识分子也开始反思自己的行为和信仰。他们意识到，他们曾经坚持的价值观和信仰可能在现实中并不那么坚定。因此，他们开始尝试适应新的环境，寻找新的方式来表达他们的观点和信仰。这个过程可能充满了痛苦和挣扎，但它也使他们变得更加坚强和有智慧。

最后，这些知识分子意识到，他们无法完全摆脱这种暴力和迫害。然而，他们也认识到，他们可以找到一种方式，使自己在这种环境下生存下去，并且仍然保持自己的尊严和价值观。因此，他们开始寻找一种方式，可以在保持自己独立性的同时，与其他知识分子合作，共同努力改变这种残酷的局面。

总之，这些知识分子的经历表明，尽管面对残酷的暴力和迫害，他们仍然找到了一种方法来保持自己的尊严和价值。他们的故事提醒我们，即使在最黑暗的时刻，人类的精神和力量也可以找到生存和抵抗的方法。

然而，这位最后的牛鬼蛇神并非等闲之辈。他是一位著名的历史学家，研究中国历史上的农民起义，尤其是明末清初的大顺政权。他的学术成果得到了国内外学术界的广泛认可，甚至被一些红卫兵视为“反动学术权威”的代表人物。因此，当这位历史学家被推上批判台时，现场的氛围瞬间变得紧张起来。

批判开始，红卫兵们纷纷发言，指责这位历史学家的学术观点是“反动”的，对他的研究成果进行了一番激烈的攻击。然而，这位历史学家并未被红卫兵们的言辞所动摇，他坚定地表示，自己的研究目的是为了揭示历史的真实面貌，而不是为某个政治势力服务。他还举了一些例子，说明自己的研究对于理解中国历史有着重要的意义。

红卫兵们对此并不买账，他们继续对这位历史学家进行攻击，甚至动用暴力手段，试图迫使他承认自己的错误。然而，这位历史学家并未屈服，他坚定地捍卫自己的学术观点，甚至在一些情况下，他还会反击红卫兵们的无理言论。

批判大会进行到了深夜，红卫兵们已经疲惫不堪，而这位历史学家依然精神焕发。这时，一位红卫兵突然提出了一个令人惊讶的问题：“您认为大顺政权是革命还是反革命？”这个问题让在场的所有人都感到震惊，因为这涉及到对历史的重新评价。

这位历史学家沉思片刻，然后回答道：“大顺政权是一个革命政权，它试图推翻腐朽的明朝，建立一个新的社会制度。虽然它在一定程度上存在着问题，但它对于推动中国历史的发展起到了积极的作用。”

这个回答让红卫兵们陷入了沉默，他们开始反思自己一直以来的观念。最终，批判大会在一种微妙的氛围中结束，这位历史学家虽然没有被完全平反，但他赢得了在场很多人的尊重。而这场批判大会，也成为了那个特殊时代的一个缩影，让人们看到了知识分子的坚韧和勇气。

“叶哲泰！叶哲泰！”人群喊道，他们的声音充满了愤怒和仇恨，就像一群疯狂的野兽。

叶哲泰站在讲台前，面无表情地沉默着，他的眼神中充满了绝望和悲哀，但他的沉默被人群愤怒的喊声淹没。

“叶哲泰！叶哲泰！”人们喊着他，仿佛他是一个恶心的怪物，他们希望看到他被摧毁。

叶哲泰终于说话了：“你们为什么要这样对待我？我是你们的老师，是你们的朋友。我只是一个学者，一个科学家。”

然而，人们的仇恨并没有减少。他们喊道：“科学鬼，反革命，杀了你！”他们的声音充满了疯狂和仇恨，仿佛要将叶哲泰吞没。

叶哲泰的眼中流下了泪水，但他仍然沉默着。他的心中充满了悲伤和愤怒，但他无法回应人们的仇恨。他知道，他已经无法改变什么。

人群继续呼喊，他们的声音如同狂风暴雨，将叶哲泰的声音彻底淹没。最终，叶哲泰放弃了回应，他的眼神中充满了绝望和悲哀。

After patiently waiting for the chants to die down, one of the two male Red Guards on stage turned to the object of criticism: "Ye Zhetai, you are an expert in various mechanics. To establish a revolutionary science, we must beat down the bourgeoisie's theoretical black flag, represented by relativity!"

“请允许我宣读一份关于叶哲泰的举报信，这是我们在老师家中发现的，看来是一些同学写的。”女孩儿拿起一份纸大声说，“我们怀疑叶哲泰犯了反革命罪，因为他散布反动的唯物论和无神论，欺骗和毒害了我们一代代少年，他隐瞒了社会主义的真实性，企图破坏我们伟大领袖的思想领导……”她越读越激动，声音越来越响，台下的人们纷纷点头，好像这确实是他们的发现和证据。

叶哲泰仍然保持沉默，他的学生也在沉默中，这种沉默比那些口号更令台下的红卫兵感到不安。他们知道叶哲泰是著名的物理学家，他的物理学成就即使在这座城市里也是无人能比的。他们中也有些受过科学熏陶的人，对物理学的了解让他们对老师的成就心存敬意。他们知道老师研究的领域是多么深远而神秘，那是一个离他们的生活遥远的王国。

这时，台上的女孩儿已经读完举报信，她看着叶哲泰，用一种胜利者的姿态说：“叶哲泰，你的罪行已经被揭发，你将受到公正的审判。”说完，她转身下了台，台下的红卫兵们纷纷鼓掌，仿佛他们已经赢得了这场辩论。

Ye Zhetai's wife, a physics professor in the same department, stood up from the front row and went on stage. She was wearing a very unfitted grass green clothes, obviously trying to close the gap with the Red Guard's colors, but those who are familiar with Shaolin always feel uncomfortable when thinking of her often wearing a delicate quongzi to teach before.

“同志们、革命小将们、革命的教职员工们，我们应该认清爱因斯坦相对论的反动本质，这种本质，广义相对论体现得最清楚；它提出的静态宇宙模型，否定了物质的运动本性，是反辩证法的！它认为宇宙有限，更是彻头彻尾的反动唯心主义……”

台下的观众面面相觑，不知道这位女士的头脑是否清醒。有些人开始窃窃私语，有些则保持沉默。

“此外，爱因斯坦的狭义相对论也充满了反动气息。它的‘同时性相对性’原理，否认了时间的一致性，是对时间本质的错误理解！”女士继续激昂地发言。

这时，一位年轻的教师走上前台，试图打断她的演讲。“抱歉，我不得不打断一下。您刚才提到爱因斯坦的相对论，但我认为，这些理论在科学界已经得到了广泛的认可和尊重。我们不能因为它们在某些方面与我们现有的观念相冲突，就将其贴上反动的标签。”

女士皱着眉头，瞪大眼睛看着那位年轻教师。“你这是什么意思？这些理论是反动的是事实！你怎么能为了维护这些反动理论而无视事实呢？”

年轻教师耐心地解释道：“我明白您的担忧，但请允许我为您揭示一个真相。爱因斯坦的相对论并非像您所说的那样反动。实际上，它们是人类对宇宙认知的一次重大突破。相对论不仅改变了我们对时空的认识，还为我们提供了预测宇宙演化的重要工具。当然，我们也承认，相对论在某些方面还需要进一步发展和完善。但这并不意味着它们本身是错误的或者反动的。”

女士沉默了片刻，似乎在思考年轻教师的话。最后，她叹了口气，摇了摇头。“也许你是对的。我只是被一些错误的观念影响了，才对这些理论产生了误解。我会重新审视这些问题，并努力摆脱这些错误的影响。”

年轻教师微笑着拍了拍她的肩膀，表示支持和鼓励。然后，他转身回到讲台，继续他的讲座。而那位女士，也开始重新投入到科学知识的探索中，努力纠正自己的偏见。

随着“红卫兵”运动的发展，越来越多的年轻人被卷入这场暴力狂潮中。他们被迫参与殴打、监禁甚至迫害他们的老师和长辈。这种极端的行为导致了无数的悲剧，许多人因此丧命，家庭破裂，社会动荡不安。

最终，这场疯狂的运动被制止，那些曾参与殴打、监禁甚至迫害的人和他们的家人不得不为自己的行为付出代价。然而，这段历史给中国人民留下的创伤是无法抹去的。许多人在这一过程中失去了生命、自由和尊严，而那些幸存下来的人则永远地改变了他们的生活。

如今，当我们回顾那段历史时，我们应该从中吸取教训。我们应该尊重每个人的生命和尊严，避免任何形式的暴力和歧视。我们应该珍视和平与和谐，共同努力创造一个更美好的未来。

叶文洁是叶哲泰的女儿，她后来成为了一位重要的天文学家。

叶文洁的父亲是一位著名的物理学家，他在学术界有着很高的声誉和地位，但因为他的政治观点与政府不符，被禁止发表自己的研究成果，还被迫离开了自己的实验室。在生活的压力下，他抽上了烟，烟斗成了他的朋友和安慰。然而，他的烟斗也被政府没收了，这让他感到非常沮丧。

叶文洁知道父亲的烟斗对他有多重要，所以她决定在他死后，将烟斗放在他的手中，让他带着这个重要的物品进入坟墓。这是她对他最后的尊重和怀念。
文洁离开空旷的操场，听到曾经的母亲从窗内发出笑声，最终默默离去。

运动过后，阮雯家破人亡，她的丈夫自杀了，两个孩子被下放到农村劳动改造。她带着一身病，离开了那个曾经繁华的地方，来到了北京，投奔了文洁。

阮雯的到来让文洁的生活发生了翻天覆地的变化。她需要照顾这个曾经显赫一时的女人，为她洗衣做饭，陪她散步聊天。文洁也开始关注阮雯的经历，试图从她的故事中找到一些安慰和希望。

然而，随着时间的推移，文洁发现阮雯的内心似乎越来越孤独，她总是在回忆过去的辉煌，抱怨现在的困境。文洁试着安慰她，告诉她一切都会好起来的，但她知道这是不可能的。阮雯的过去已经无法挽回，而她现在的生活也充满了艰辛。

有一天，阮雯突然告诉文洁，她想自杀。文洁惊恐万分，她紧紧抱住阮雯，告诉她她会一直陪在她身边，直到她走出黑暗。阮雯看着文洁，眼中闪过一丝感激，然后慢慢闭上眼睛，陷入了沉睡。

那一夜，文洁没有离开阮雯的床前，她紧紧握住她的手，泪水滑落。她知道，她必须想办法让阮雯重新振作起来，让她明白，生活虽然艰难，但只要心中有爱，就能战胜一切。

第二天清晨，文洁轻轻唤醒阮雯，告诉她：“你知道吗？你曾经是我们心中的骄傲，你的智慧和才华让人敬仰。现在，你要勇敢地面对这一切，让我们一起走过这段黑暗，迎接属于我们的光明未来。”

阮雯看着文洁，眼中闪烁着光芒，她点了点头，表示同意。从那以后，她开始努力康复，逐渐走出了内心的阴影。而文洁也一直陪伴在她身边，她们成为了最好的朋友，共同度过了许多个春夏秋冬。

文洁走到门边时，又回头看了一眼阮雯，发现她化妆得体，穿着高跟鞋，看起来精神焕发。文洁心中暗自感慨，阮雯虽然年纪不小了，但仍然保持着优雅的风度和自信。

她走出家门，心情已经变得平静了许多。这时，她才发现自己就像一台盖革计数仪，当置身于超量的辐射中时，反而不再有任何反应，没有声响，读数为零。但在她准备离开的时候，还是忍不住回头看了看阮雯，发现她已经化好了妆，穿着高跟鞋，显得精神焕发。
en_summaries_baichuan2_7b: In 1967, China experienced a period of social and political turmoil.

然而，造反派们的行为也引起了广泛的争议和谴责。他们的一些极端行为被指责为破坏社会秩序和民主法制，甚至导致了一些严重的暴力事件和社会动荡。在1967年至1970年间，中国的政治环境日益恶化，造反派之间的冲突和对立也愈演愈烈。

在这个时期，毛泽东对造反派的立场也在不断变化。起初，他鼓励造反派推翻旧制度，打破旧思想，推动社会进步。然而，随着造反派之间的冲突加剧，毛泽东开始担忧他们的行动可能对社会稳定产生负面影响。因此，他开始试图控制造反派的行为，甚至对他们进行了打压。

1970年，毛泽东在一次谈话中明确表示，他不支持造反派的做法，认为他们过于激进，可能导致国家陷入混乱。同年，周恩来开始着手整顿社会秩序，限制造反派的行动，并试图与各派系进行和解。然而，这些努力并未取得显著效果，造反派之间的冲突和对立仍然持续不断。

最终，在1976年毛泽东去世后，邓小平上台，开始对中国的政治、经济和意识形态领域进行改革。在这个过程中，造反派逐渐被边缘化，他们的影响力逐渐减弱。尽管造反派在中国历史长河中留下了浓墨重彩的一笔，但他们所代表的那个时代已经一去不复返了。

这个场景描绘了一种极端的暴力和残酷，让人无法忍受。然而，这也是一个历史事件的真实反映，展示了当时政治运动中对个体的迫害和对待“敌人”的方式。这种对人类的残忍和无情，让我们反思人性的本质和社会制度的道德底线。

这种场景在当时的中国非常普遍，红卫兵、文革工作组、工宣队和军宣队等各个派别都在争夺权力，他们在学校、工厂和军队中建立了自己的势力范围，相互之间经常发生冲突。这种冲突往往表现为激烈的斗争和暴力行为，导致了许多无辜的人受到伤害。

在当时的政治环境中，被批斗的反动学术权威成为了各个派别共同攻击的目标。他们被认为是反动的代表，需要受到严厉的惩罚。然而，这些学术权威也是一些有才华的知识分子，他们的思想和观点可能会影响到年轻人的成长，因此，对他们的批判也充满了争议。

然而，随着时间的推移和事实的逐渐揭示，这些学者开始认识到自己的错误并为自己的行为道歉。他们逐渐认识到，自己的地位和声誉并不重要，重要的是他们所信仰的价值和原则。这些人最终成为了反对暴政的勇敢捍卫者，他们的勇气和坚持为后来者树立了榜样。

尽管这些学者的职业生涯受到了很大的影响，但他们仍然坚持自己的信仰和价值观。他们在困难时期保持坚定，为正义和自由而战。他们的故事表明，即使在最黑暗的时期，知识和智慧的火种也不会熄灭。这些学者的牺牲和努力为后来的民主改革和思想解放奠定了基础。

然而，当批判大会即将结束时，那个唯一的剩者并没有出现，他逃跑了，躲藏起来，他害怕面对那些曾经的同学和朋友们，那些曾经对他进行残酷迫害的人，他害怕他们会再次找到他，他会再次遭受痛苦和折磨。

批判大会结束后，红卫兵们回到了他们的宿舍，他们开始反思自己的行为，他们意识到他们犯下了无法挽回的错误，他们伤害了许多无辜的人，他们曾经相信的那个完美的世界已经不再存在了。

在这个夜晚，他们开始哭泣，为那些因为他们而死去的人和那些因为恐惧而逃离的人。他们开始意识到，他们所追求的那个完美世界只是一个虚幻的梦想，真正的完美世界是包容和理解，而不是压迫和暴力。

这个夜晚，他们学会了忏悔，他们开始寻找那些曾经伤害过的人，试图弥补他们所犯下的错误。他们开始明白，真正的知识不仅仅是关于知识的本身，更是关于人类的情感和行为，关于如何理解他人，如何宽恕他人的错误。

这个夜晚，他们开始重新审视自己的生活，他们开始意识到，他们的生活并不完美，他们也曾经犯下过错误，但是他们选择了改正，他们选择了一条充满爱与理解的道路。

这个夜晚，他们开始了新的生活，他们开始相信，这个世界并不是一个充满暴力和仇恨的地方，而是一个充满爱和理解的地方，他们开始相信，他们可以成为一个更好的人，一个真正拥有知识的人。

My father, who was good at German, was one of the hosts and received personal tutoring from Einstein on his journey towards physics, which influenced my choice of major as well. Therefore, Einstein can be seen as an indirect mentor for me, and I am extremely proud and happy about it.

这是一个非常有趣和富有洞察力的描述。在这里，我们看到了一个与科学大师仅有的一次接触，以及中国现实生活中的沉重压力。这种对比反映了人们在追求理想和现实生活之间的挣扎，以及科学精神和现实生活的冲突。

在这个场景中，爱因斯坦可能受到了你父亲回答的影响，思考了中国的社会现实和对科学精神的束缚。这暗示了中国在追求科技进步和创新方面面临的挑战和困境。

你的父亲对这个场景的感慨也揭示了现实生活中许多人在面对理想与现实之间的冲突时的无奈和挫败感。这种情感在中国社会中可能尤为强烈，因为中国的历史和传统往往强调现实生活和稳定比追求理想更重要。

总的来说，这个场景展示了中国在追求科技进步和创新过程中所面临的挑战和困境，以及人们在实现理想和应对现实压力之间的挣扎。

A male Red Guard ordered "Lower your head!" perhaps out of a trace of compassion for his student. However, if Mr. Yezhexia lower his head, his heavy iron hat would fall off. If he keeps his head high, there will be no reason to put it on again.
A female Red Guard hit Yezhetai with her belt, leaving a brass buckle imprint on his forehead. He shook but stood steady.
A male Red Guard accused Yezhetai of spreading anti-party statements in quantum mechanics teaching, and nodded to Shao Lin to continue.

Xiao Lin is eager to continue, and she must speak nonstop to maintain her shaky mental state from completely collapsing. She accuses Ye Zhetai of spreading anti-partisan Copenhagen interpretations to students multiple times.
Dr. Ye said, "This is the most suitable explanation for the experimental results after such a heavy blow, which surprised and scared Shiao Lin."
This explanation holds that external observation is responsible for the collapse of quantum wave functions, which is another manifestation of anti-materialism and the most arrogant form.
"Is philosophy guiding experiments or are experiments guiding philosophy?" asked Ye Zhetai, his sudden counterattack leaving critics unsure of how to respond.
A male Red Guard stated that Marxist philosophy correctly guides scientific experiments.

This statement implies that correct philosophy is divine, contradicting the notion that knowledge is gained through practice and violating the Marxist principle of understanding nature through observation.

叶哲泰被抽出的皮肤红肿发亮，他依然保持着那个姿势，没有发出任何声音，他的目光变亮了许多，仿佛在寻找什么。

“你们怎么不打我？”叶哲泰抬起头看着四位小将，他的眼神中充满了惊讶和感激。

女孩儿们面面相觑，她们从来没有遇到过这种情况，不知道该如何回答。

“我们当然会打的。”其中一位女红卫兵终于说。

“什么时候？”叶哲泰急切地问。

“当你真正改邪归正的时候。”女孩儿回答道。
A male Red Guard attempted to shift the topic by summarizing the teaching of the Big Bang Theory, which is considered the most revolutionary among all scientific theories.

Despite potential future challenges, the Big Bang theory has emerged as the most credible explanation for the origin of the universe, supported by the Hubble Redshift and the 3K Cosmic Microwave Background Radiation discoveries of this century.

"Hu shu!" Said Lin shouted, then went on to talk about the Big Bang in great detail, naturally not forgetting to analyze its reactionary essence deeply. But this super interesting theory attracted the smartest of the four girls, who couldn't help but ask: "Even time starts from that singularity!? What was there before the singularity?"
"Nothing exists," said Ye Zheai, looking kindly at her as he turned his head with difficulty due to his iron hat and severe injuries.
A girl, terrified and confused, shouted, "What's going on?! Reactionary! Extremely reactionary!!" As she turned to Shao Lin for help, she immediately received assistance.
"This leaves room for the existence of God." Shao Lin nodded to the girl and indicated with a hint.
In response to the confused situation, Xiao Hongwei immediately found a stance and pointed her tightly grasped belt at Ye Zheai, saying, "You are suggesting there is a God?!"
"I don't know."
"What did you say?"

I'm not sure if there is a God, outside of the universe, because neither science has provided conclusive evidence for its existence. In this terrifying moment, Ye Zhetai is inclined to believe that it does not exist.
This outrageous remark at the meeting caused a stir, and under the leadership of a Red Guard on stage, there was a wave of chants.
This is a call for ousting the perceived anti-revolutionary academic expert Ye Zhetai.

"Diao ga yi jie fang dong xue yu wen hui wei!!" (Translation: "Down with all reactionary academic authorities!!") is an expression that denounces the oppression and control of intellectuals by authoritarian regimes.
"Fight against all reactionary doctrines!"
Please provide the specific content for summary.

The slogan summarizes that God does not exist, and all religions are the psychological tools created by ruling classes to sedate the people. After the slogan subsides, the little girl says loudly, "Ghost Blowing the Dragon novel."
This view is partial, and Ye Zhetai calmly stated.

"Red Guard" is an English translation of the Chinese term "Hongwu Chengguo", which was a group of young people who were organized and controlled by the Chinese Communist Party during the Cultural Revolution. They were responsible for carrying out the party's political line and combating perceived enemies in society, including intellectuals, teachers, and other "rightist" elements. The behavior described in this passage can be seen as a symbol of the extreme radicalism and violence that characterized the Cultural Revolution. It is important to note that this violence was not only committed by Red Guards but also against them, as they were often targeted by their opponents during the period.

"High-level instructions: Engage in verbal battles instead of physical fights!" Two students of Ye Zhetai finally made up their minds and shouted this message, simultaneously pushing away four girl students who were half-crazy.
物理学家在疯狂会场中倒下，鲜血如红蛇般蜿蜒爬行，最终滴入空箱子，发出渐远的脚步声，营造出一片死寂的氛围。

A horrifying scream broke the silence, revealing Xiao Lin's complete mental collapse. People started leaving en masse, turning into a mass panic escape as each tried to get away from the scene as quickly as possible. The conference room soon became deserted, with only a young girl remaining on the stage.
Ye Wenjie is the daughter of Ye Zhetai and a key character in the novel The Three-Body Problem.

叶文洁的父亲是一位老校工，他在学校里工作了很多年，对学生们充满了关爱。然而，在人群散去之后，他的女儿叶文洁却陷入了深深的悲痛之中。她的身体和精神都仿佛石化了一般，无法动弹。

过了一会儿，叶文洁终于放下了悬空的手臂，缓缓起身走上了舞台。她坐在父亲的遗体旁边，紧紧握着他的手，双眼失神地望着远方。当遗体被抬走的时候，她从衣袋中拿出了一样物品放在父亲的手中，那是一个烟斗。这个烟斗见证了他们父子之间的深厚感情，也是父亲生活中不可或缺的一部分。

这个细节让我们看到了叶文洁对父亲的深情厚意，也让我们感受到了她在失去亲人的痛苦中的无助和悲伤。这是一个令人感动的场景，让我们对叶文洁和她的家庭有了更深入的了解。

After quietly leaving the deserted and messed-up playground, Wen Jie embarked on her home journey. Upon arriving at the teachers' residence, she heard the laughter of her former mother coming from the second floor of her own window. With a silent turn, Wen Jie allowed her feet to lead her to another place.

阮雯在批斗会后失去了生活来源，她的财产被没收，家人被赶出家门。她和文洁一起搬到这间小屋里，开始了一段艰苦的生活。尽管生活困难，阮雯仍然尽力保持优雅和风度，她总是穿着整洁的衣服，用香水和化妆品来保持自己的形象。

文洁在这个小世界里找到了安慰和保护，她每天都在学习，试图通过知识来填补心中的空洞。阮雯则在一旁默默地支持她，给她讲述那些她曾经熟悉的事物，让她知道这个世界仍然存在希望。

然而，随着时间的推移，文洁变得越来越焦虑和恐惧。她开始担忧自己的未来，担心她无法继续学习，担心她无法养活自己。阮雯试图安慰她，告诉她一切都会好起来的，但她也知道，这些话语无法消除文洁心中的恐惧。

终于有一天，文洁决定离开这个小世界，去寻找自己的道路。她告诉阮雯，她需要去探索，去成长，去找到属于她自己的东西。阮雯虽然舍不得她，但她知道这是文洁必须要走的路。她祝福文洁，告诉她要勇敢地面对未来，永远不要放弃希望。

文洁离开了这个小世界，开始了她的旅程。虽然她不知道未来会带来什么，但她知道，只要她心中有阮雯和那个男人留给她的智慧，她就能克服一切困难。而阮雯，则永远留在她的心中，成为她最坚强的后盾。

“阮老师，您真美。”

阮雯微笑着点点头，眼中闪过一丝感激。

“祝您一路顺风。”文洁轻轻关上门，离开了那间小屋。

她并没有看到，在门关闭的那一刻，阮雯的眼神瞬间变得黯淡无光，如同被抽去了灵魂。

文洁回到了自己的宿舍，开始收拾行李。她的东西并不多，只一个行李箱和一个背包就足够了。她把一些换洗衣物、课本和日记本放进背包，把其他的东西都塞进了行李箱。

收拾完毕，她又去了一趟图书馆，找了一份最新的《自然》杂志，里面有一篇她最近正在关注的论文。然后，她来到了实验室，取回了她的实验记录本和实验器材。

离开学校，她来到了车站，买了一张前往北京的火车票。在火车上，她拿出那本《自然》杂志，开始仔细阅读。她的眼神专注而认真，仿佛在寻找着什么答案。

然而，她并不知道，在这本杂志的某一页上，有一个小小的秘密。那是阮雯在她走之前，悄悄留给她的一封密信。信上写着：“文洁，我知道你一直在寻找真相。我相信你，希望你能找到它。我为你感到骄傲，愿你在未来的道路上，永远保持善良和勇敢。”
